{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thumb-sucking habit can lead to malocclusion, which is a misalignment of the teeth and jaws. In this case, the child has a Class-II malocclusion, anterior open bite, and an over-jet of 12mm. A cephalogram is an X-ray of the head that shows the skeletal and dental structures. In this case, the cephalogram is likely to show changes in the facial heights due to the malocclusion. The over-jet of 12mm indicates that the upper front teeth are protruding significantly. Based on this information, the cephalogram is likely to show increased anterior facial height. However, there is no specific information to suggest changes in the posterior facial height. Therefore, the answer choice is B. Increased anterior facial height and normal posterior facial height.", "answer_choice": "B"}
